meanings.definition: To dig or excavate with a tool or hands.
meanings.sent1: The children were howking in the sand to find buried treasure.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist was howking through the soil to uncover ancient artifacts.
meanings.sent3: The dog was howking in the garden, looking for a bone it buried earlier.
meanings.sent4: She was howking through her memories to find the exact moment they met.
meanings.sent5: The miners were howking deep into the earth to extract precious minerals.

meanings.definition: To search or rummage through something.
meanings.sent1: The detective was howking through the suspect's belongings for clues.
meanings.sent2: She was howking in her bag for her lost keys.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon was howking through the trash for something to eat.
meanings.sent4: He was howking through the old books at the library sale.
meanings.sent5: The kids were howking through the toy box to find their favorite game.

meanings.definition: To extract or remove something forcefully.
meanings.sent1: The dentist had to howk out the stubborn tooth.
meanings.sent2: She had to howk the nail out of the wall with a hammer.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to howk out the burnt bits from the bottom of the pot.
meanings.sent4: He had to howk the thorn out of his finger carefully.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic had to howk the broken part out of the engine.
